children.speaker: Kafka
children.line: Seems I came at a bad time.
No no — I think you couldn't have timed it better.

line: 23:47:15 system time. Very punctual, Kafka.

speaker: Kafka
line: Elio always tells the exact future. So what's with the explosion just now? Was that also part of his script?
Uh-huh — "23:44:59 system time: The pulses from the explosion cause a massive breakdown from the master control system."

speaker: Kafka
line: You did that?
No, the Antimatter Legion did it. They completely invaded the space station two system hours ago.

speaker: Kafka
line: *whistle* Alright, so do we need to fight the Legion?
I dunno. Elio didn't say anything about it, so it doesn't matter.

speaker: Kafka
line: Got it. So from now on, I'll be in charge of this operation.
Copy. Can you let me have some fun this time? Our last few operations turned out to be pretty dull.

speaker: Kafka
line: ...Sorry, I'm afraid there's not much I can do for you — our task this time is just to "place" the target properly.

speaker: Kafka
line: But if you wanna go look for some fun yourself, I won't stop you. I mean, after all...

children.speaker: Kafka
children.line: Elio didn't put it in the script.

html_content:
(Enter battle against Antibaryon ×1, Voidranger: Reaver ×1)
(Interactive tutorial)
(After entering battle)
Use Basic ATK on selected enemy
(After the second turn starts)
Select the enemy on the right as your target
Switch to your Skill for a stronger attack
Use Skill on the selected enemy

text: Use a fake identity to get past security check

title: Mission Description
content: The woman sauntering elegantly across the invasion site is a mystery. She mocks the victims, while also ruthlessly eliminating their oppressors.Over their comms, the mysterious helper revealed that the two seem to have some sort of agenda. Is their presence a sign of more chaos to come? Or is it the start of a new story?

html_content:
(Interactive tutorial)
Move your character
Use Sprint while moving to boost your Movement Speed.

speaker: Kafka
line: Who's this? Herta?
Yeah.

speaker: Kafka
line: She looks so young. She was already famous in the last Amber Era , no? She has to be at least a hundred years old.
She's a member of the Genius Society and an Emanator of Nous the Erudition . She can probably age backwards if she wanted.

speaker: Kafka
line: Hah. I seem to recall that over half of the Genius Society's eighty-odd members had a normal death. Wasn't there someone who only lived for a dozen days or so? What was their name...
That's pretty normal. Aren't the immortal bosses in games always waiting for the protagonist to come kill them? Immortality is not always a good thing.

speaker: Kafka
line: Hah. What an Alliance joke.

speaker: Herta
line: This is Madam Herta, or better known as member 83 of the Genius Society. In her childhood, she solved the solitary waves theory and the Spark model hypothesis. In her adolescence, she found the Sigma Baryons conversion method. In middle-age, she proposed the Herta sequence and published a paper on de-aging.

speaker: Herta
line: In her senior years, she managed to reverse her own age via de-aging, and went on to solve the mystery of the imaginary leakage phenomenon, and even captured and sealed a stellaron. Madam Herta has saved the planet she was on from destruction 19 times and has met the Aeons twice.

speaker: Herta
line: This space station is her property.

text: (Investigate left table one time only, optional)
Papers covered in math lie scattered on the table. Their author seems to have left in a hurry.
(Investigate right table one time only, optional)
You don't need any space station terminal.

This is the space elevator, which you took to arrive at the space station. As for how you used the enchantment of Spirit Whisper on the elevator security staff — there's no need to go over that right now.

speaker: Kafka
line: When did the Antimatter Legion become so weak?
I could only attract this much. Did you really want the entire Legion to come here?

speaker: Kafka
line: This lot won't be able to slow down the Astral Express crew .
Relax. A Doomsday Beast is also here.

text: Go through the corridor and enter the interior of the space station

speaker: Kafka
line: This is Zandar. Zandar One Kuwabara. The first genius in history.
The one who supposedly created Nous?

speaker: Kafka
line: That's him... If the legends are true, then he was a man who created an Aeon.
Well they better be false. I don't want to be a Zandar hunter.

speaker: Herta
line: Zandar One Kuwabara, Genius Society member 1. I hung up his portrait purely out of respect. Without him, there would be no Genius Society today.

speaker: Herta
line: Frankly, I don't know what he has achieved. None of his books and inventions have survived, but there's gotta be a place for the founder of the Society, right?

speaker: Kafka
line: ...I know this person. She's the Lord of Silence, Polka Kakamond. See? Her face is all blank. She had destroyed all of her own portraits and sculptures in the entire universe...
I'm not interested. Hurry up with our real business.

speaker: Herta
line: Polka Kakamond, member #4 of the Genius Society. A woman full of mystery. Many people in the Society died by her hand. I haven't heard anything about her for many years, but I firmly believe she is still alive.

speaker: Herta
line: Hey, Lord of Silence, if you're here, if you're listening... I'm member 83, Herta, and I want to meet you. I believe you and I will have a lot to talk about.

speaker: Kafka
line: Who's this?
No idea.

speaker: Herta
line: This is Aiden, member 22 of the Genius Society. The most selfless and the strangest one. He spent his whole life helping others. Personally, I don't see the point.

speaker: Herta
line: But the Society is famous thanks to him. The Interastral Peace Corporation has been trying to find a replacement ever since his death. They searched for many Amber Eras, but no genius was willing to lower their head to the IPC... Until they found me.

speaker: Kafka
line: Who's this old guy with a white beard?
No idea. A Society member?

speaker: Herta
line: Oh, Elias Salas, such a lovely old fellow. He is Member 56 of the Genius Society, one of the only two publicly elected Ministers in the Society's history. Be grateful to him! He created the Synesthesia Beacons and over-range remote sensing, the cornerstones of modern cosmic communication.

speaker: Herta
line: However, he did not disclose his inventions to the public, so I hereby certify that the rights of these two technologies belong to the Intelligentsia Guild . To be honest, I am not a big fan of the Guild, but it is impressive that they managed to reproduce Elias Salas' inventions.

speaker: Kafka
line: Hey! Silver Wolf! Look! It's Screwllum, your good old opponent.
Hahhhh... I told you already. I didn't know it was him...

speaker: Kafka
line: Ah, that battle was how Elio got his eyes on you. Imagine, someone actually able to crack Screwllum's code! First Screwllum, then Herta... there's probably no one else in the universe who offended two genii in such quick succession. It must be destiny.
Urgh... Seems like I'm the real Destiny's Slave here.

speaker: Herta
line: Member 76 of the Genius Society, Screwllum. I have known him for a long time. He is a really good man, a gentleman with an exceptional mechanical mind. I have learned a lot from him.

speaker: Herta
line: Recently, I have been working with him and Ruan Mei on a project ! I hope this project can help us get closer to the greatest mystery of the universe...

text: Taking out a lone Voidranger is just a warm-up

children.text: The enemy is now within the character's attack range
Attack selected enemy to trigger combat

html_content:
(Enter battle against Antibaryon ×1, Voidranger: Reaver ×2, Voidranger: Distorter ×1, Baryon ×1)
(Interactive tutorial)
(After entering battle)
All characters possess a powerful Ultimate, wich can be used when their Energy is full.
Fight enemies to regenerate Energy
(After being hit by Voidranger: Distorter)
You are at full energy. Activate your Ultimate now.
Use Ultimate to attack all enemies

children.line: Cleaning up other people's mess isn't in my job description...

speaker: Kafka
line: *sigh* Yeah, yeah. Where did you send it, Silver Wolf?

speaker: Silver Wolf
line: Some random coordinates, not important. You care about where that Voidranger ended up?

speaker: Kafka
line: Of course not~ I'm just amazed at this fancy technique of yours, as usual.

speaker: Silver Wolf
line: Just a little trick of tampering with the data of reality, I wouldn't call it fancy.

speaker: Kafka
line: What were you looking at so intently just now? Let me see.

speaker: Silver Wolf
line: Herta's toys, a catalog featuring the space station's collection of rare items . They've got a lot of interesting gadgets.

speaker: Kafka
line: Like what?

speaker: Silver Wolf
line: There's this gun , it can rate any creature within its crosshair as a score from 0 to 100.

speaker: Kafka
line: ...Doesn't sound very interesting.

speaker: Silver Wolf
line: Aren't you curious about how much you would score? I kinda wanna know mine.

speaker: Kafka
line: Fine, I guess we can swing by and play with it if it's not too far. What's our destination?

speaker: Silver Wolf
line: Go down the corridor behind the door on the left. There's a room where some kind of rare item is stored.

speaker: Kafka
line: So that's where the Stellaron is?

speaker: Silver Wolf
line: That's where we can find out where the Stellaron is.

text: Meet up with Silver Wolf and leave the Reception Center

title: Step Description
content: The woman's helper emerges from the darkness and steps forward. This young-looking girl seems to have found the information she was looking for in the space station's database.The target is the room in the depths of the corridor."Is that where the Stellaron is?" "It can tell us where the Stellaron is."

text: Silver Wolf[Story]has joined the team temporarily
Switch your team's new addition, Silver Wolf , onto the field.
(Investigate screen on the center table one time only, optional)
"Emergency Evacuation" flashed onto the display, and the front-of-house receptionist carried out the instructions.

(Investigate Emblem of the Space Station, optional)
(Initial interaction)

speaker: Kafka
line: Herta... Have you ever met her? I'm curious about the tastes of someone who used their own name for a space station.

speaker: Silver Wolf
line: Never seen the real one. Saw plenty of her portraits, though.

speaker: Kafka
line: What a pity.

text: You see the emblem of the space station. It looks like a spear piercing through the moon.
You see the emblem of the space station. It looks like a rubber arm holding a noisy horn.
You see the emblem of the space station. It looks like an earphone that has cracked a hole in an egg.
You see the emblem of the space station. It looks like an eye undertaking an intraocular pressure test.
You see the emblem of the space station. It looks like a space station.
Welcome to Herta Space Station. Here, you can savor the bounty of the ocean of knowledge. Please also beware of the risk of drowning.

speaker: Kafka
line: Now, this hint is useless.

speaker: Silver Wolf
line: Who knows what's in the brains of those following the Erudition?

text: If you need help, go to the Galaxy Room in the base zone.
Welcome to Herta Space Station. Here, you can savor the bounty of the ocean of knowledge. Please also beware of the risk of drowning.

This month's financial reimbursement reminder notice: Researchers, please summarize the reimbursement materials for this month on a single reimbursement form. (Please contact the corresponding section if you have any expedited documents.)
This month's commercial insurance claim reminder: Please submit your online claim by the 21st of this month.

Claims cannot be made in the following cases: Not carrying the space station member's identification code for medical treatment; not visiting the space station medical office (private surgeries, independent medical offices, and other unofficial channels are difficult to verify, so please be careful)
Venture further following the route provided by Silver Wolf

speaker: Silver Wolf
line: The central area of the space station is up ahead. There will be lots of Legion Voidrangers there.

speaker: Kafka
line: Okay~

html_content:
(Enter battle against Voidranger: Eliminator ×1)
(Interactive tutorial)
(After entering battle)
Characters and enemies act in sequence from the top to the bottom of the Action Order.
Ultimates are not affected by the Action Order and can be used in any turn
(After Silver Wolf reaches maximum energy)
You are at full energy. Activate your Ultimate now.
After an Ultimate becomes available, it can be used immediately
Use Silver Wolf's Ultimate to defeat enemies

(Interactive tutorial)
Open Tutorials
Unlocked Tutorial contents can be checked in Tutorials

text: Something's not right about the Monitoring Room at the end of the corridor

speaker: Kafka
line: Hold it.

speaker: Kafka
line: Someone, or something, is up ahead.

speaker: Silver Wolf
line: Looks like we're the ones getting ambushed.

speaker: Kafka
line: But they're the ones getting besieged.

html_content:
(Enter battle against Voidranger: Reaver ×2, Voidranger: Distorter ×2)
(Interactive tutorial)
(After entering battle)
Skill Points is a combat resources [sic] shared by the whole team.
Switch to Skill
Consume Skill Points to use Skills.
(After Silver Wolf's turn begins)
All Skill Points have been used.
Skills cannot be used when insufficient Skill Points are present.
Use Basic ATK to recover team Skill Points.

speaker: Kafka
line: Not a single soul here. Impressive evacuation work. Did Herta organize it herself?

speaker: Silver Wolf
line: According to the access history, she hasn't logged in here for over six months. The evacuation was directed by the acting lead researcher — a girl named Asta .

speaker: Kafka
line: Doesn't ring a bell. Oh, right, Elio said we wouldn't run into Herta. It seems she really isn't here.

speaker: Kafka
line: Where's the Stellaron ?

speaker: Silver Wolf
line: Elio's script doesn't include any info about the location of the Stellaron, which means in the future he foresees...

speaker: Kafka
line: ...We would find the Stellaron in a non-physical way?

speaker: Silver Wolf
line: This space station is packed with extraordinary objects, I wouldn't be surprised if there's one that can make it happen.

speaker: Kafka
line: Hiding something extraordinary with something extraordinary... this is pretty Herta. I assume you know what to do? I mean, you've read that catalog for quite a while.

speaker: Silver Wolf
line: I've got all the clues we need. The only piece missing is a simple trick.

speaker: Silver Wolf
line: Help me investigate the terminal in this room, our item might be inside.

speaker: Kafka
line: Okay, the stage is yours~

text: Assist Silver Wolf with investigating the terminals in the Monitoring Room

title: Step Description
content: The two arrive at the Monitoring Room to find a maze left by the absent space station's owner."Using a Curio to hide another Curio sounds like something she would do."But oftentimes, knowing the way does not equate to knowing how it ends.

speaker: Silver Wolf
line: Help me investigate the terminal in this room, our item might be inside.

speaker: Kafka
line: I can see the whole space station on the surveillance screen... but not the Stellaron.

speaker: Silver Wolf
line: Even if you could, it'd be a trap. Herta doesn't display her collections.

speaker: Kafka
line: Huh? I can't see the memory storage for this terminal...

speaker: Silver Wolf
line: This is the monitoring room, they must have deleted the records and made a run for it. Classic.

speaker: Silver Wolf
line: *sigh* Make your way over here then, there's no point in trying to search like this.

text: However, Silver Wolf seems to have already understood it all

speaker: Kafka
line: So, got a master plan? I'm all ears.

speaker: Silver Wolf
line: It's a matter of hacking the surveillance system directly.

speaker: Kafka
line: Aha, I see. Herta's collections aren't in the system, so anything unaffected should be our target.

speaker: Silver Wolf
line: Simple, crude, but effective. Look, found it.

text: Interact with the Curio to unravel the secret in the Monitoring Room

speaker: Kafka
line: Huh. What's this?

speaker: Silver Wolf
line: Item number 211, "Blind Spot": A simple light-deflecting field. It allows an object in its field to pass unnoticed, but if a different item ceases to be obvious, the object gets revealed.

speaker: Kafka
line: So Herta hides her collection with something as simple as this?

speaker: Silver Wolf
line: The simplest method is the hardest to spot, isn't that our motto?

text: Silver Wolf is nodding her head, seems it's not that simple

speaker: Kafka
line: *whistle* Strange thing number two...

speaker: Silver Wolf
line: The data suggests it's just an ordinary hologram. But it has an added layer...

speaker: Kafka
line: Let's take a look. Don't worry, this place won't be our grave.

text: She said something strange will happen if you touch the screen

(Investigate screen)
(Kafka and Silver Wolf are teleported into a new area)
Get the Stellaron with Silver Wolf's help

title: Step Description
content: In the end, the woman slowly reaches out her hand toward the Stellaron.She is well aware she is not the protagonist of this story.Well then, the preparations have been made. It's time to wake up and set off on your journey.

speaker: Kafka
line: Interesting, she's a member of the Genius Society alright.

speaker: Silver Wolf
line: The Stellaron is up ahead, let's hurry.

text: This is Stellaron [ sic ] — what Stellaron Hunters throughout the universe all hunt for. But in truth, it's all just a front. Elio knows it, Blade knows it, and you know it, too. Stellaron Hunters have another true goal.

That's why the Stellaron that Herta sealed away will be put to another use. Once Silver Wolf breaks its seal, you'll have to take it and place it inside a kind of "vessel" that's been waiting for just this occasion...

speaker: Silver Wolf
line: It has its own security system... I guess even for Herta, a Stellaron is no ordinary rarity.

speaker: Kafka
line: Can you get it?

speaker: Silver Wolf
line: Of course, even the genius Herta can't compete with me when it comes to hacking.

speaker: Kafka
line: Good, then I'll also count on you with the preparation of the receptacle.

children.speaker: Kafka
children.line: Elio said this decision will bring about lots of changes.

children.speaker: Silver Wolf
children.line: He also said, it must be you who makes it.

speaker: Silver Wolf
line: Why are you standing around? Having second thoughts?

speaker: Kafka
line: Yeah. We've always been the ones taking Stellarons. It's the first time we're giving one out.

speaker: Silver Wolf
line: You're gonna think for this long? Didn't make up your mind when you got out of bed this morning?

speaker: Kafka
line: Don't hurry me, Silver Wolf. This is a big decision.

speaker: Silver Wolf
line: Come on, I'll pick for you! This one, yeah, this one!

speaker: Kafka
line: Uh, Silver Wolf? Did you forget that I must be the one to make this decision?

speaker: Silver Wolf
line: Wanna give ( him / her ) a new name?

speaker: Kafka
line: There we go.

speaker: Kafka
line: How much does ( he / she ) remember?

speaker: Silver Wolf
line: ...They'll remember you.

speaker: Kafka
line: Time to get up.

children.speaker: Kafka
children.line: A space station, but that's not important.

children.speaker: Silver Wolf
children.line: Maybe you're not as important as you think.

speaker: Kafka
line: Listen : You are in a daze right now. You don't know who you are, why you're here, or what you're going to do next. You think I look familiar, but you're not sure if you should trust me—

speaker: Kafka
line: ...None of that matters. All you need to know is that I'm leaving, and you will be left all alone on this space station. From now on, you needn't think about your past or doubt yourself.

speaker: Kafka
line: Listen : In the near future, you will encounter all kinds of perils and hardships, but you will also have many wonderful experiences. You'll meet companions who treat you like family, and embark on surreal adventures with them...

speaker: Kafka
line: At the end of your journey, all that perplexes you and troubles you will resolve.

speaker: Kafka
line: This is your future that Elio has foreseen. Do you like it?

children.speaker: Kafka
children.line: Listen : Remember what you're feeling in this moment. As long as you know in your heart where you're heading, you are guaranteed to see the ending of your story.

children.speaker: Kafka
children.line: Listen : Elio can foresee the future, but he can't make decisions for you.

children.speaker: Kafka
children.line: Use that will of yours to reach the end of your story. That's the you I like.

children.speaker: Kafka
children.line: The next stop, to pave the way for the future that is written.

children.speaker: Kafka
children.line: It's like weaving brocade — you and I can only add one gold thread each time, but eventually, we will make a gorgeous pattern.

speaker: Silver Wolf
line: How long do you think you need? According to the script, the Astral Express crew is arriving soon. We should avoid being seen by them.

speaker: Kafka
line: I know, Silver Wolf. Just give me another minute.

speaker: Kafka
line: I must leave now. Listen : Don't worry. Someone will come and find you very soon, just go with them. You won't remember a thing except me.

speaker: Kafka
line: When you have a chance to make a choice, make one that you know you won't regret...
